verses.kjv: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
verses.ct: In Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went together into the Jewish synagogue and spoke so effectively that a large number of both Jews and Greeks came to believe.

verses.kjv: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.
verses.ct: But the Jews who refused to believe poisoned the minds of the Gentiles and turned them against the brothers.

verses.kjv: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
verses.ct: So Paul and Barnabas stayed there for a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

verses.kjv: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
verses.ct: The people of the city were split — some sided with the Jews, and some sided with the apostles.

verses.kjv: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use them despitefully, and to stone them,
verses.ct: When both the Gentiles and the Jews, along with their leaders, plotted to mistreat and stone them,

verses.kjv: They were ware of it, and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:
verses.ct: they found out about it and escaped to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding area.

verses.kjv: And there they preached the gospel.
verses.ct: There they continued to spread the good news.

verses.kjv: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked:
verses.ct: In Lystra there was a man sitting who had been unable to use his feet — he had been disabled from birth and had never walked.

verses.kjv: The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
verses.ct: This man was listening to Paul speak. Paul looked directly at him and could see that he had the faith to be healed.

verses.kjv: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.
verses.ct: So Paul called out in a loud voice, "Stand up on your feet!" The man jumped up and began walking.

verses.kjv: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.
verses.ct: When the crowd saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, "The gods have come down to us in human form!"

verses.kjv: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.
verses.ct: They called Barnabas "Jupiter" and Paul "Mercury," since Paul was the main speaker.

verses.kjv: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.
verses.ct: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple stood at the entrance to the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the gates and wanted to offer sacrifices to them along with the crowd.

verses.kjv: Which when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,
verses.ct: When the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about this, they tore their clothes in grief and rushed out into the crowd, shouting,

verses.kjv: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:
verses.ct: "People, why are you doing this? We are just human beings like you! We are here to bring you good news — that you should turn away from these worthless things and toward the living God, who made heaven, earth, the sea, and everything in them.

verses.kjv: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
verses.ct: In past generations, he allowed all nations to go their own way.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.
verses.ct: Yet he has never left himself without evidence of his goodness. He gives you rain from heaven and productive harvests, providing you with plenty of food and filling your hearts with joy."

verses.kjv: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.
verses.ct: Even with these words, they barely managed to stop the crowd from offering sacrifices to them.

verses.kjv: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew him out of the city, supposing he had been dead.
verses.ct: Then some Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium and won the crowd over. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, assuming he was dead.

verses.kjv: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
verses.ct: But as the disciples gathered around him, he got up and went back into the city. The following day, he left with Barnabas for Derbe.

verses.kjv: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and to Iconium, and Antioch,
verses.ct: After they had shared the good news in that city and gained many disciples, they traveled back to Lystra, then to Iconium, and then to Antioch.

verses.kjv: Confirming the souls of the disciples, and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: They strengthened the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to remain firm in the faith, and telling them, "We must go through many hardships to enter the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.
verses.ct: Paul and Barnabas appointed elders for them in every church, and with prayer and fasting, they entrusted them to the Lord in whom they had put their faith.

verses.kjv: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
verses.ct: After traveling through Pisidia, they arrived in Pamphylia.

verses.kjv: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:
verses.ct: They proclaimed the message in Perga, and then went down to Attalia.

verses.kjv: And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.
verses.ct: From there they sailed back to Antioch, where they had originally been entrusted to the grace of God for the mission they had now completed.

verses.kjv: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
verses.ct: When they arrived, they gathered the church together and reported everything God had accomplished through them, and how he had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: And there they abode long time with the disciples.
verses.ct: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.
